DataElement.preferredName: Year Local-Regional Urothelial Neoplasm Additional Surgical Procedure Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the year of additional surgical procedure for new locoregional urothelial tumor event.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Local-Regional Urothelial Neoplasm Additional Surgical Procedure Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Affecting only a restricted part or area of the body.__Transitional epithelium lining the renal pelvis, bladder, ureter, and part of the urethra._(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth._Derived as a result of a primary condition; not direct or immediate; of second rank or importance or value.__Added; extra; further._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Local-Regional; affecting only a restricted part or area of the body.:Transitional epithelium lining the renal pelvis, bladder, ureter, and part of the urethra.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Concepts.definition: Of or belonging to both a local and regional area of the body.
Transitional epithelium lining the renal pelvis, bladder, ureter, and part of the urethra.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Added; extra. (from American Heritage Dictionary):A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Event; something that happens at a given place and time._The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Event; something that happens at a given place and time.:The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: Something that happens at a given place and time.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
